meanings.definition: To strike or hit with great force.
meanings.sent1: He whally the ball with all his might.
meanings.sent2: She whally the door closed when she was angry.
meanings.sent3: The chef whally the dough to make it flat for the pizza.
meanings.sent4: The thunderstorm whally the trees, making them sway violently.
meanings.sent5: The hammer whally the nail into the wood, creating a loud sound.

meanings.sent1: The boulder was a massive whally in the middle of the field.
meanings.sent2: She struggled to lift the heavy whally onto the shelf.
meanings.sent3: The whally in the room turned out to be a giant stuffed bear.
meanings.sent4: The old ship had a rusty whally anchor hanging off its side.
meanings.sent5: The elephant in the zoo was a gentle whally, despite its size.

meanings.sent1: The car whally down the street, leaving a trail of dust behind.
meanings.sent2: She whally through the crowd to catch the bus before it left.
meanings.sent3: The wind whally the leaves off the trees in a swirling dance.
meanings.sent4: The athlete whally towards the finish line, determined to win.
meanings.sent5: The river whally over the rocks, creating a soothing sound.
